description: A prototype that never saw light of day, the 90s IDW is (would've been) the smallest SMG in the world.  It's made from machined steel, being heavier than it looks.  Using 9mm Parabellum bullets, it was supposed to be highly customizable, allowing attachments for the stock, sights, barrels, and even a bipod.  It also featured an electronic control mechanism to regulate the rate of fire to automatically limit the recoil.

description: A selective fire automatic rifle designed for the Swiss military.  This is an old iteration of the 550 series, heavier and bulkier.
